result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin R Purves was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Loss of good time due to jail violations
Columbia County Court Conviction DNA - DNA taken
Filed by Atty Amanda Riek.
Filed by Atty Amanda Riek.

Cases called: 16CF151 & 15CF113, Defendant, Kevin R Purves, appeared with Atty. Amanda Riek. Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin. In 16CF151, Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over.   Information filed, reading waived. Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to count 3 in 16CF151 and count 2 in 15CF113. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment, sentence withheld in 16CF151, 2 yr. probation, $518 costs to be paid in first year of probation, review in six months. Complete AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations. Submit DNA sample. In 15CF113, Court imposed 30 days jail, commencing  July 8, 2016 at 7 p.m. Huber granted pursuant to WI. Stat. 303.08, may transfer to Dane Cty. Jail.  $243 costs,  60 days to pay fine or set up a payment plan with Clerk of Courts. Submit DNA sample. All remaining counts in both case dismissed and read in. 3 days jail credit in each case.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 3, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
Atty. Riek requests this case be set for plea/sentencing with 16CF151
Atty. Riek's follow-up letter regarding her request for plea/sentencing be set on this case for June 3 so that it tracks with 16CF161

This should also include what items can be returned.
